intro: Claytonia leucocephala, commonly known as the white mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Claytonia leucocephala is also known for its ability to survive in arid conditions due to its thick, fleshy leaves that store water.
